page.title: 11NEWSPAPER ARTICLE
page.content: A group of Telford schoolchildren set out to find some local footpaths recently _ and found that most of them had disappeared. The children from Orleton Park School, Wellington,had been given the area of Great Bolas and Eaton Upon Tern to study as part of their work for the BBC's Domesday Project. But when they tried to follow the many footpaths marked on the map some of them got lost because paths were no longer there. "We found out that most of the footpaths in the area had either been blocked or had been ploughed up.That annoyed us a bit because our group thought we had taken the wronge turning,"said Helen Scholey. The children are writing down everything they can find about the Doomsday Project.1
